question: 年輩
sourceMnemonic: Someone who is a <kanji>comrade</kanji> with <kanji>year</kanji>s has been around a lot of said years. They are an <vocabulary>elderly person</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word, which usually means on'yomi readings from the kanji. If you know the readings of your kanji you'll know how to read this as well. The <ja>はい</ja> goes to a <ja>ぱい</ja>, because elderly persons love pie, right?
